SEATE
LAND EVACUATION
EXIT OPER
Aceeee outeide conditione at Smernencv Evite.
If fire, water above the door sill or dangerous debris exists,
EMERGENCY EXIT ROW
SEATING INSTRUCTIONS
Si Ud. está sentado en una fila de asientos
cerca de una salida del
avion, y no puede entender, ni hablar, ni el leer inglés, por favor
indentriquese a la tripulacion
Si vous êtes assis dans une rangée a côté d'une sortie de l'avion,
vous ne pouvez pas comprendre, ni parler. ni lire l'anglais, S.V.P.
contactez l'équipage.
Falls Sie bei einem Noutausaand sitzen und nicht Endlisch verstehen.
melden Sie sich bitte bei einem Flugbegleiter.
Afai oe alala mai i se nofoa o lo'o lata ane i se faitotoa, ae e te le
malamalama ile faa-inilisi, fa'amolemole fa'ailoa mai ile auvaa.
If vou are seated in a desianated emerdencv exit seat
U.S. Federal Aviation Regulations require that passengers seated in
emergency exit seats have sufficient mobility, strength and dexterity
to open emergency exits in the event that a crewmember Is not
available to assist.
Please notify a crewmember it another seat
assignment is required if you do not want to, or are unable to help in
the event of an emergency for any or the tollowing reasons.
1. You lack the strength, dexterity or mobility in both arms and
hands and legs:
To reach upward, sideways and downward to the location of
the emergency exit and exit slide operating mechanisms;
B. To grasp and push, pull, turn or otherwise manipulate those
To push, shove, pull or otherwise open emergency exits;
To lift out. hold. deposit on nearov seais or maneuver over
seatbacks to the next row, objects the size and weight of
overwing exit doors;
To remove obstructions similar in size and weight of overwing
exit doors;
To reach the emergency exit expeditiously;
To maintain balance while removing obstructions;
To exit expeditiously;
To stabilize an escape slide after deployment; or
To assist others in getting off the slide and away from the aircraft.
2. You are less than 15 years of age or lack capacity to perform one
or more of the above functions without assistance of an adult
comnanion parent or other relative
3. You cannot understand oral crew
instruetione
rolatort to
emergency evacuation provided by HAWAIIAN AIRLINES in
nrinter or aranhic torm
or cannot
understand oral crew
commands in the Enalish lanquage used by the airline.
You cannot see well enough to perform one or more of the above
functions without the assistance of visual aids beyond contact
lenses or evealasses.
You cannot hear well enough to understand instructions shouted
by crewmembers without assistance beyond a hearing aid.
Vouseannet imnart information verhallv to other nassenders
You have:
A condition or responsibility such as caring for small
children that would prevent you from performing one or
more of the ahove functions… on
A condition that might cause you personal harm if you
performed one or more of the listed functions.
Now. prior to takeoff. carefully study and fully understand the functions
indicated on this Safetv Card. Please contact a crewmember if vou have
millsfield:images_texts:
FOR YOUR SAFETY
HAWAIIAN
Please Do Not Remove Card From Aircraft
8712
HAWAIIAN
AIRLINES.
Federal regulations
require that all pas-
sengers comply
with any illuminated
sign, printed placard
and/or verbal safety
instructions given
by a crewmember.
Under federal law, no
person may assault,
threaten, intimidate, or
interfere with a
crewmember in the per-
formance of their duties
aboard an aircraft under
operation. Federal law
permits penalties for
crew interference to
include substantial fines
(up to $10,000), impris-
onment, or both.

WATER EVACUATION
EXIT
INFLATE UPON EXITING
